poem:
**Fog at Venice**

In the inbox, the old flirtations surface—  
leather, massages, fog thick enough  
to hide a body drifting offshore.  

Now the apology: deeply regrets,  
as if regret could launder words,  
as if the calendar were alibi.  

But emails don't forget.  
They wait, like tide-marks,  
for the daylight to return.

Among the exchanges included one from Wasserman telling Maxwell “I think of you all the time. There is also an email exchange about massages and one in which Maxwell asks whether it will be foggy enough during an upcoming visit “so that you can float naked down the beach and no one can see you unless they are close up?” Wasserman responds: “or something like that.” In a statement released Saturday, Wasserman said: “I deeply regret my correspondence with Ghislaine Maxwell,” which he said occurred “long before her horrific crimes came to light”. “I never had a personal or business relationship with Jeffrey Epstein. As is well documented, I went on a humanitarian trip as part of a delegation with the Clinton Foundation in 2002 on the Epstein plane. I am terribly sorry for having any association with either of them,” he said. In 2021, Maxwell was convicted on five counts of sex trafficking and abuse". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
